data.key_point: 主詞動詞不一致: she have to
data.explanation: 當主詞是第三人稱單數時（如 he, she, it），助動詞 'have' 應使用 'has'。這是一個基礎的文法規則，稱為主詞與動詞的一致性（Subject-Verb Agreement）。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 為了實現目標，她必須全力以赴。
original_error.user_answer: In order to achieve her goal, she have to do her best.
original_error.correct_answer: To achieve her goal, she has to give it her all.

review_examples.correct_answer: My brother does his homework every day.

data.key_point: 詞語可以更道地: do her best
data.explanation: 雖然 'do her best'（盡力而為）是正確的，但中文的「全力以赴」帶有更強烈的「毫無保留、用盡一切努力」的意味。使用 'give it her all' 或 'go all out' 這樣的片語能更生動地傳達這種感覺，讓表達更貼近母語人士的用法。
data.correction: give it her all / go all out

original_error.chinese_sentence: 為了實現目標，她必須全力以赴。
original_error.user_answer: In order to achieve her goal, she have to do her best.
original_error.correct_answer: To achieve her goal, she has to give it her all.

data.key_point: 表達可以更簡潔: In order to
data.explanation: 'In order to' 是正確的，但在多數情況下，尤其是在句首，可以直接使用 'To' 來表達目的，這樣會讓句子更簡潔有力。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 為了實現目標，她必須全力以赴。
original_error.user_answer: In order to achieve her goal, she have to do her best.
original_error.correct_answer: To achieve her goal, she has to give it her all.

data.key_point: 條件句否定用法錯誤: keep don't take
data.explanation: 在 if 引導的條件句中，當主詞是第三人稱單數（the government）時，其否定形式應使用 `does not + 原形動詞`。`keep don't take` 是不正確的文法結構，混合了兩種不同的概念。
data.correction: does not take / fails to take

original_error.chinese_sentence: 若政府再不採取有效措施，環境污染恐將對公眾健康造成無法挽回的損害。
original_error.user_answer: If the government keep don't take effective action, the pollution of environment might have a irrevertable impact on people's health.
original_error.correct_answer: If the government does not take effective measures soon, environmental pollution will cause irreversible damage to public health.

data.key_point: 單字拼寫錯誤: irrevertable
data.explanation: 「無法挽回的」正確的英文單字是 `irreversible`。`irrevertable` 是不存在的單字，可能是由 `revert` 和 `-able` 錯誤組合而成。另一個相似的詞是 `irreparable`（無法修復的）。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 若政府再不採取有效措施，環境污染恐將對公眾健康造成無法挽回的損害。
original_error.user_answer: If the government keep don't take effective action, the pollution of environment might have a irrevertable impact on people's health.
original_error.correct_answer: If the government does not take effective measures soon, environmental pollution will cause irreversible damage to public health.

data.key_point: 不定冠詞 a/an 使用錯誤: a irrevertable
data.explanation: 不定冠詞的選擇取決於其後單字的「發音」而非「字母」。`irreversible` 的開頭是母音發音 /ɪ/，因此前面應該使用 `an` 而不是 `a`。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 若政府再不採取有效措施，環境污染恐將對公眾健康造成無法挽回的損害。

data.key_point: 詞語搭配不夠道地: the pollution of environment
data.explanation: 雖然 `the pollution of environment` 文法上可以理解，但 `environmental pollution` 是更常用、更自然的標準說法，其中 `environmental` 作為形容詞修飾 `pollution`。

data.key_point: 詞彙選擇可以更精準: people's health
data.explanation: 「公眾健康」在英文中有對應的專有名詞 `public health`，這個詞彙更精準地表達了原文中涉及整個社會群體的健康議題。`people's health` 雖然意思相近，但較不正式。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 若政府再不採取有效措施，環境污染恐將對公眾健康造成無法挽回的損害。
original_error.user_answer: If the government keep don't take effective action, the pollution of environment might have a irrevertable impact on people's health.
original_error.correct_answer: If the government does not take effective measures soon, environmental pollution will cause irreversible damage to public health.

data.key_point: 冠詞遺漏: to library
data.explanation: 在英文中，"library" (圖書館) 是一個可數名詞。當我們指稱一個大家通常會去的特定場所時，前面需要加上定冠詞 "the"。因此，「去圖書館」的正確說法是 "go to the library"。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我哥哥週末常去圖書館看書。
original_error.user_answer: My brother often goes to library to read books on weekend.
original_error.correct_answer: My brother often goes to the library on weekends.

data.key_point: 名詞單複數錯誤: on weekend
data.explanation: 中文的「週末」在這裡指的是一個常態性、重複性的習慣（每個週末都可能去）。在英文中，表達這種重複發生的時間，應該使用複數形式。因此，要用 "on weekends" 來表示「在週末期間」或「每逢週末」。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我哥哥週末常去圖書館看書。
original_error.user_answer: My brother often goes to library to read books on weekend.
original_error.correct_answer: My brother often goes to the library on weekends.

data.key_point: 表達可以更簡潔自然: to read books
data.explanation: 雖然 "to read books" 文法上完全正確，但在 "go to the library" (去圖書館) 的語境下，「看書」這個活動是理所當然的。為了讓句子更簡潔、更道地，可以直接說 "My brother often goes to the library on weekends."，聽者會自動理解他去那裡是為了閱讀。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我哥哥週末常去圖書館看書。
original_error.user_answer: My brother often goes to library to read books on weekend.
original_error.correct_answer: My brother often goes to the library on weekends.

data.key_point: 冠詞/複數用法錯誤: on weekend
data.explanation: 「Weekend」是可數名詞。當表示「在週末」這個時間點時，前面通常需要冠詞，例如「on the weekend」(美式) 或「at the weekend」(英式)。如果想表達「每逢週末」的習慣性動作，則應該使用複數形式「on weekends」。中文原句「會去」帶有習慣性的意味，因此使用複數「on weekends」更為貼切。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 他們週末會去公園野餐。
original_error.user_answer: They go picnicking in the park on weekend.
original_error.correct_answer: They go for a picnic in the park on weekends.

data.key_point: 動詞片語可以更多元: go picnicking
data.explanation: 「go picnicking」的用法是正確的。不過，「去野餐」還有其他常見且自然的說法，例如「go for a picnic」或「have a picnic」。在句子中替換使用可以讓表達更豐富。例如：「They go for a picnic in the park on weekends.」
data.correction: go for a picnic / have a picnic

original_error.chinese_sentence: 他們週末會去公園野餐。
original_error.user_answer: They go picnicking in the park on weekend.
original_error.correct_answer: They go for a picnic in the park on weekends.

data.explanation: 句中的時間副詞 'last week' (上週) 表示動作發生在過去，因此動詞 'buy' 應使用過去式 'bought'。

data.key_point: 不可數名詞的複數形式: homeworks
data.explanation: 'Homework' 在英文中是不可數名詞，沒有複數形式。即使指的作業量很多，也只能用 'homework' 或 'a lot of homework'。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 弟弟每天寫作業。
original_error.user_answer: My brother do homeworks everyday.
original_error.correct_answer: My brother does his homework every day.

data.key_point: 副詞 'every day' 的拼寫: everyday
data.explanation: 'everyday'（一個字）是形容詞，意思是「日常的」，例如 'everyday life'（日常生活）。當要表達「每一天」這個時間頻率時，應該使用副詞片語 'every day'（兩個字）。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 弟弟每天寫作業。
original_error.user_answer: My brother do homeworks everyday.
original_error.correct_answer: My brother does his homework every day.

data.key_point: 慣用語與介係詞錯誤: for daily basis
data.explanation: 表達「每天」的常見說法是 'every day' 或 'on a daily basis'。此處使用 'for' 是不正確的，且 'basis' 前面應有冠詞 'a'。然而，更精準的翻譯應根據原句的「每天早上」，使用 'every morning'。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我的爸爸每天早上讀報紙。
original_error.user_answer: My father reads news paper for daily basis.
original_error.correct_answer: My father reads the newspaper every morning.

data.key_point: 漏譯「早上」: for daily basis
data.explanation: 中文原句是「每天早上」，而學生的翻譯只表達了「每天」的意思，遺漏了「早上」這個重要的時間點。最直接且準確的翻譯是 'every morning'。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我的爸爸每天早上讀報紙。
original_error.user_answer: My father reads news paper for daily basis.
original_error.correct_answer: My father reads the newspaper every morning.

data.key_point: 拼寫錯誤: news paper
data.explanation: 'newspaper' 是一個複合名詞，應該寫成一個單字，而不是分開的兩個字 'news paper'。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我的爸爸每天早上讀報紙。
original_error.user_answer: My father reads news paper for daily basis.
original_error.correct_answer: My father reads the newspaper every morning.

data.key_point: 冠詞的使用: reads news paper
data.explanation: 當我們談論讀報紙這個日常習慣時，通常會使用定冠詞 'the'，因為指的是一種普遍的、特定的活動或物品。'reads the newspaper' 是更自然的說法。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我的爸爸每天早上讀報紙。
original_error.user_answer: My father reads news paper for daily basis.
original_error.correct_answer: My father reads the newspaper every morning.

data.key_point: 動詞 go 後面接目的地時，需加介係詞 to: goes school
data.explanation: 動詞 'go' 表示「去某個地方」時，後面需要加上介係詞 'to' 來連接目的地。這是一個固定的用法，例如 'go to the park'、'go to the store'。因此，「去上學」的正確說法是 'go to school'。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 她每天搭公車上學。
original_error.user_answer: She goes school by bus everyday.
original_error.correct_answer: She goes to school by bus every day.

data.key_point: everyday (形容詞) vs. every day (副詞片語)
data.explanation: 'everyday' (一個字) 是形容詞，意思是「日常的、普通的」，用來修飾名詞，例如 'everyday clothes' (日常服裝)。'every day' (兩個字) 是副詞片語，意思是「每一天」，用來修飾動詞，說明動作發生的頻率。在此句中，是要表達「每一天」都去上學，所以應該使用副詞片語 'every day'。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 她每天搭公車上學。
original_error.user_answer: She goes school by bus everyday.
original_error.correct_answer: She goes to school by bus every day.

data.key_point: 語意錯誤: 完全偏離原句意思: This is a test answer
data.explanation: 學生的翻譯「This is a test answer」（這是一個測試答案）與中文原句「公園裡有很多小朋友在玩」的意思完全無關。這可能是對題意的誤解，或是未能嘗試翻譯原句。正確的翻譯需要表達「有很多小朋友」(There are many children) 和他們「在公園裡玩」(playing in the park) 的概念。
data.correction: There are many children playing in the park.

original_error.chinese_sentence: 公園裡有很多小朋友在玩。
original_error.user_answer: This is a test answer
original_error.correct_answer: There are many children playing in the park.

data.key_point: 冠詞錯誤: 遺漏冠詞: takes bus
data.explanation: 在英文中，'bus' 是一個單數可數名詞。當提到單數可數名詞時，前面通常需要加上一個冠詞（如 a/an, the）或其他的限定詞。因為這裡描述的是每天的例行公事，使用 'the bus' 來表示她搭乘的固定路線或交通方式，是最自然的用法。'takes a bus' 雖然文法也正確，但 'the bus' 更能表達習慣性。另一個非常道地的說法是 'She goes to school by bus every day'。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 她每天搭公車上學。
original_error.user_answer: She takes bus to school every day.
original_error.correct_answer: She takes the bus to school every day.

data.key_point: 動詞搭配錯誤: go watching: go watching
data.explanation: 「go + V-ing」這個句型通常用於表示從事某項休閒活動，例如 go swimming (去游泳)、go shopping (去購物)。然而，「看電影」這個活動通常不使用「go watching」。更自然的說法是「go see a movie」、「go to see a movie」或「go to the movies」(去電影院)。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我明天會去看電影。
original_error.user_answer: I will go watching movie tomorrow.
original_error.correct_answer: I am going to see a movie tomorrow.

data.key_point: 冠詞錯誤: movie 前缺少冠詞: movie
data.explanation: 「Movie」是一個單數可數名詞，在句子中通常需要一個冠詞 (a/an/the) 或其他限定詞。當我們泛指「一部電影」時，應該用「a movie」。如果指的是去「電影院」這個地方，則常用「the movies」。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 我明天會去看電影。
original_error.user_answer: I will go watching movie tomorrow.
original_error.correct_answer: I am going to see a movie tomorrow.

data.key_point: 冠詞錯誤: beach → the beach: to beach
data.explanation: 「beach」是可數名詞。當我們指「去海邊」這個活動或地點時，習慣上會使用冠詞「the」，形成固定片語「go to the beach」。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 他們週末會去海邊。
original_error.user_answer: They go to beach on weekend.
original_error.correct_answer: They go to the beach on the weekend.

data.key_point: 介係詞片語錯誤: on weekend → on the weekend: on weekend
data.explanation: 表示「在週末」的標準英文說法是「on the weekend」（美式用法）或「at the weekend」（英式用法）。這裡漏掉了冠詞「the」。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 他們週末會去海邊。
original_error.user_answer: They go to beach on weekend.
original_error.correct_answer: They go to the beach on the weekend.

data.key_point: 動詞形式錯誤: balancing → to balance: do our best balancing
data.explanation: 片語「do one's best」（盡力）後面應該接不定詞（to + 原形動詞），用來表示「盡力去做某事」。因此，正確的文法結構是 'do our best to balance'。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 儘管面臨許多挑戰，我們仍應盡力平衡工作與生活，以確保身心健康。
original_error.user_answer: Although facing many difficulties, we should still do our best balancing works and life, to maintain our health.
original_error.correct_answer: Despite facing many challenges, we should do our best to balance work and life to ensure our physical and mental well-being.

data.key_point: 名詞單複數錯誤: works → work: works
data.explanation: 當「work」指「工作、職業」時，是一個不可數名詞，沒有複數形式。複數的「works」通常指「作品」（如藝術品、文學作品）或「工程」，在此語境中不適用。

original_error.chinese_sentence: 儘管面臨許多挑戰，我們仍應盡力平衡工作與生活，以確保身心健康。
original_error.user_answer: Although facing many difficulties, we should still do our best balancing works and life, to maintain our health.
original_error.correct_answer: Despite facing many challenges, we should do our best to balance work and life to ensure our physical and mental well-being.

data.key_point: 翻譯不完整: our health → our physical and mental health: our health
data.explanation: 中文原句的「身心健康」同時包含了「身體」和「心理」兩個層面。只用「health」稍嫌籠統，翻譯成「physical and mental health」或更簡潔的「well-being」能更精準地傳達原意。
data.correction: our physical and mental health / our well-being

original_error.chinese_sentence: 儘管面臨許多挑戰，我們仍應盡力平衡工作與生活，以確保身心健康。
original_error.user_answer: Although facing many difficulties, we should still do our best balancing works and life, to maintain our health.
original_error.correct_answer: Despite facing many challenges, we should do our best to balance work and life to ensure our physical and mental well-being.

data.key_point: 用詞建議: Although... still → Despite: Although facing many difficulties, we should still
data.explanation: 1. 「Although」後面通常接一個完整的子句（主詞＋動詞），例如「Although we face...」。若要直接接名詞或動名詞片語（V-ing），使用介係詞「Despite」或「In spite of」會更自然。 2. 中文的「仍」在「Although」的句型中通常是多餘的，因為「Although」本身已帶有轉折語氣。 3. 原文的「挑戰」翻譯成「challenges」比「difficulties」更貼切。
data.original_phrase: Although facing many difficulties, we should still
data.correction: Despite facing many challenges, we should

original_error.chinese_sentence: 儘管面臨許多挑戰，我們仍應盡力平衡工作與生活，以確保身心健康。
original_error.user_answer: Although facing many difficulties, we should still do our best balancing works and life, to maintain our health.
original_error.correct_answer: Despite facing many challenges, we should do our best to balance work and life to ensure our physical and mental well-being.
